name: bisphenol A epoxy based vinyl ester resin production | bisphenol A epoxy based vinyl ester resin | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14304/documentation

This dataset represents the production of bisphenol A (BPA) epoxy Vinyl Ester Resins (VER).;This resin belongs to the vinyl ester (or vinylester, VE) composite resin category. They are often used as matrix for composite materials, when applied on glass fibre, carbon fibre or natural fibres (ex: flax).;The perimeter of this data includes the manufacturing of the resin from raw materials.; Resin type is bisphenol A epoxy based vinyl ester resin (VER).;Typical characteristics:;Appearance: Clear liquid resin.;Main applications: Corrosion/chemical resistance.;Other possible applications: Glass flake coatings - heat resistance, pipes, tanks, containers, floor coverings.;Specific weight at 25 °C: 1,05-1,10 g/cm3;Viscosity (mPa.s): V23 - Brookfield at 23 oC, Spindle Speed 50 rpm: 250-450.;Solid content (%) PC53: 56-60.;Their uses are widespread, from transport mean components to pipes, tanks and vessels, etc.  They provide high strength and chemical resistance.;The use of one resin over another depends on the user required physical caracteristics.;Data for the life cycle inventory for this resin were primarly taken from the Ernst & Young Report: "Life cycle assessment of four generic unsaturated polyester (UP) resins and one vinyl ester (VE) resins", Revised version, September 2014. The following companies participated in the study: Reichhold, Polynt Composites, Ashland Performance Materials.

Cradle to gate. This activity starts with the raw materials delivery at the manufacturing plant gate.

Cradle to gate. This activity ends with the bisphenol A epoxy based vinyl ester resin at the manufacturing plant gate. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2013:Manufacture of plastics and synthetic rubber in primary forms

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Based on the average production of three European producers: Polynt Composites, Reichhold and Ashland, representing a significant part of the European production.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This resin is manufactured from styrene, liquid epoxy resin, bisphenol A and glycidyl methacrylic acid.;Resin manufacturing process. Source : "Life cycle assessment of four generic unsaturated polyester (UP) resins and one vinyl ester (VE) resins", Revised version, September 2014, Ernst & Young Accountants;Not included in this dataset, there are different shaping solutions for this resin in order to obtain a usable, finished or semi-finished product. The most common are sheet molding compound (SMC) and bulk moulding compound (BMC). It can be reinforced with fibres, such as glass fibre, in order to modify its mecanical properties and allow new uses.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The infrastructure impacts have been assessed based on chemical industry average infrastructure, as no specific data was available.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The data come from three different European producers. The average values have been used.

exchanges.description: This resin belongs to the vinyl ester (or vinylester, VE) composite resin category. They are often used as matrix for composite materials, when applied on glass fibre, carbon fibre or natural fibres (ex: flax). Typical characteristics: Appearance: Clear liquid resin. Main applications: Corrosion/chemical resistance. Other possible applications: Glass flake coatings - heat resistance, pipes, tanks, containers, floor coverings. Specific weight at 25 °C: 1,05-1,10 g/cm3 Viscosity (mPa.s): V23 - Brookfield at 23 oC, Spindle Speed 50 rpm: 250-450. Solid content (%) PC53: 56-60. Their uses are widespread, from transport mean components to pipes, tanks and vessels, etc.  They provide high strength and chemical resistance. The use of one resin over another depends on the user required physical caracteristics.
